title: Drawing, Design for Large Two-Part Cabinet Built into Niche, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Large Two-Part Cabinet Built into Niche
medium: Graphite, green color pencil on thin cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Recto: inscribed in graphite, upper left corner of sheet: Mrs. CR Hurd / [illeg.] / Milton / 923 Wednesday / [illeg.]; upper center of design: corner cabinet; along left edge of design: $55 / Marble / Shelves [?] / Window [arrow pointing right] / $200; along right edge of design: corner hanging / Bookcase / leaded glass doors / window / Scale 7 10'+7 foot [sic]; center bottom of design: $150.  Verso: diverse unidentified partial sketches center left, upper center, and right
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular upper detached piece of cabinet has 2 glass doors in front panel; lower piece of cabinet has central horizontal drawer flanked by 2 drawers on either side and surmounted by narrow segment consisting of central niche with pair of small drawers on either side; cabinet ensemble installed in tall wall niche with gabled ceiling.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Large Two-Part Cabinet Built into Niche, 1900–05. Graphite, green color pencil on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-234
